item.title: Overwatch 2: How to Type Messages in Gradient Text
item.description:
Overwatch 2 players will be well familiar with how the text channels work across group chat, team chat, and match chat. However, anyone who has been playing during Season 17 may also have begun to notice some strange occurrences happening in the text channels of their matches. Specifically, colored text, gradients, and even symbols and emojis have started to appear in player messages.

This undoubtedly left players wondering how such a feature is even possible. It has not been a feature in prior seasons, and nothing like that was announced for Season 17. If you find yourself curious about how players are creating these strange and entertaining text messages and how you can do so yourself, all relevant information has been outlined in the guide below.

How to Type Colored Text, Gradients, & Emojis in Overwatch 2

In Overwatch 2 , incorporating colored text, text gradients, and symbols/emojis are all possible through the use of hex codes . This is not usually available for Overwatch 2 players, and has not been an officially announced feature. This has left players speculating that this is likely a bug that appeared following a gameplay patch, that was not supposed to be accessible by users. For this reason, it is uncertain if the devs will choose to leave this feature for players to have fun with, remove it in a future patch or bug fix update, or instead choose to fully implement it for player enjoyment. If you're looking to try it out while you still can, an explanation has been added below.

Hex codes can be copy pasted into the message bar to use in OW2 . A list of different colors and symbols has been included below. Custom colors can be implemented by adding any color hex code, and gradients are created by using multiple hex codes across a single word.

To use these codes, you will need to add them inside angle brackets, as in:

  • [EXAMPLECODEGOESHERE]

If you have text-to-voice on, the bot will unfortunately read all letters/numbers of the hex code, so you may either want to turn this off or avoid using it for now.

item.title: Wuchang Fallen Feathers: All Inner Demons Locations (Bo Blood)
item.description:
Bo Blood is an important upgrade material in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, used to increase both the charges and duration of the Maddening Incense . To obtain these upgrades, players must locate and defeat the Inner Demons, powerful enemies that drop Bo Blood along with a Needle used for Tempering slots . Some of these Inner Demons are truly missable if you progress too far in the story without defeating them. This guide includes the exact locations of all Inner Demons in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers .

All Inner Demons Locations in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

Bo Blood #1 + Shadow Stone Needle - Agility

  • Nearest Shrine: Annalum ( Worship's Rise )

From the Annalum Shrine, head into Annalum and follow the path. Go up the steps ahead and turn right to reach a wooden walkway. Turn around once the walkway ends and go down the path to find a small chest at the end. This is where a Demon will manifest, and you can defeat it.

Bo Blood #2 + Shadow Stone Needle - Strength

  • Nearest Shrine: Doomwillow Beach ( Worship's Rise )

Turn around from the Shrine and head straight to the far left path, where an enemy is ringing a bell to alert the nearby four-legged grotesque creatures. Deal with the enemies and follow the path to reach a Blood River , where you’ll find another bell-ringing enemy. Head straight through the Blood River and turn right to spot two trees, which are actually hostile. Here, you will fight a Demon and can take advantage of the trees, as they will try to inflict Corruption on the Demon.

Bo Blood #3

  • Nearest Shrine: Cloudspire Outskirts ( Cloudspire )

Turn around from the Cloudspire Outskirts Shrine and head straight toward the doorway. Turn right and go to the broken-down house on the left, where you'll find a ladder you can climb. Ignore the Corruption block , which is spawning enemies, and head left, going past numerous enemies and a guy shooting cannonballs at you. Soon, you'll spot a burning house —that's where the next Demon will spawn.

Bo Blood #4 + Shadow Stone Needle - Feathering

  • Nearest Shrine: Snowfall Palace ( Cloudspire )

Head straight up the stairs, turn right, and follow the path until you reach the main room with the elevator and the enemy using a bow. Stand on the elevator to make it go up— this will reveal a compartment below that leads to the treasure room . Head down, and in one of the corners, you’ll spot a small chest where the Inner Demon will manifest.

Bo Blood #5 + Plumed Stoned Needle - Temper

  • Nearest Shrine: Refugee Camp ( Mt. Zhenwu )

Head down from the Shrine and turn right toward the tent area. Follow the path to the water, and at the end, you will find a Demon next to a small chest.

Bo Blood #6 + Root Stone Needle - Status

  • Nearest Shrine: Avian Marsh ( Mt. Zhenwu )

Turn around from the Shrine, head toward the clam enemy on the left path, and go up the slope. When you encounter the first Summoner enemy, deal with him and approach the Withered Branch on the right. You will drop down into an area where the Demon will manifest.

Bo Blood # 7 + Everlight Stone Needle – Continuity

  • Nearest Shrine: Shu Sacntum ( Worship's Rise in Ruins )

After going past the point of no return and reaching the fourth region, follow the linear path until you reach the same area where the Lu Hongliu fight took place. Heading up the stairs will trigger the boss fight with the Nightmare Demon , who drops the Bo Blood and the Needle.

You can interact with the Shu Sanctum to the right of the boss arena to have a Shrine nearby.

Bo Blood #8

  • Nearest Shrine: Shrine Dwelling ( Bo Capital )

For the last Bo Blood, you’ll need to defeat the Demon of Obsession, a secret boss locked behind the third riddle door. The Mysterious Gate is located next to the Depths of the Capital Shrine , and upon interacting with it, you’ll be given two options. Select the " The wheel turns anew " option to be teleported to the Shrine Dwelling area , where you can find the boss down the stairs.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound is the Perfect Title for Game Pass
item.description:
During the Game Awards 2024, Koei Tecmo and Dotemu announced a brand-new game in the Ninja Gaiden series called Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound . Contrary to what some people expected, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound was revealed not to be a mainline title, but rather a 2D side-scrolling action game, similar to the NES-era entries in the franchise. The game, the companies confirmed, was being developed by the creators of the Blasphemous series, The Game Kitchen, and they said it would target a 2025 release window on all modern platforms, including last-gen consoles.

At the time of its announcement, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound was significant because it was the first original Ninja Gaiden game to be produced in more than a decade. However, as many may know by now, it is no longer the only new entry in the franchise that's being released this year. Two other Ninja Gaiden games, Ninja Gaiden 2 Black and Ninja Gaiden 4 , were announced by Koei Tecmo during the Xbox Developer Direct a few months ago. Interestingly, Ninja Gaiden 4 and Ninja Gaiden 2 Black were both revealed as day-one Game Pass games, unlike Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound . Since the game has already been released and can therefore no longer come to Game Pass on day-one, it should follow in the footsteps of its peers by getting added to the service in the future.

Ninja Gaiden 2 Black was shadow-dropped during the Xbox Developer Direct, while Ninja Gaiden 4 is set to be released in October 2025.

Out of All the Recent Ninja Gaiden Games, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound Would Fit Game Pass the Most

Despite Being Cheap, Some People May Be Hesitant to Buy Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound

Compared to the other recent games in the series, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound is not a particularly expensive title. The game costs just $25 on all major storefronts, and there's even a 10% off sale for it that's going on for the next few days. Given that the game was developed by an indie team and is not a blockbuster 3D action title, like Ninja Gaiden 4 is, its low price tag shouldn't come as a surprise. However, in spite of its affordable nature, some gamers — especially those who are unfamiliar with the Ninja Gaiden series — may be unwilling to shell out the dough for Ragebound .

Ninja Gaiden Needs to Regain Lost Players, So It Should Be Accessible to as Broad an Audience as Possible

Ninja Gaiden may have had an instrumental role in retro gaming history, but the franchise isn't that well known among younger audiences. The series, as previously mentioned, hasn't been active for a long time, and even when it was being consistently supported during the mid-to-late 2000s, its potential for growth was hampered by various factors. Ninja Gaiden 's notoriously challenging combat, frequent platform exclusivity, and confusing naming conventions have made it hard for the franchise to attract newcomers, in spite of it cultivating a passionate fan base.

Since Ninja Gaiden still needs to regain the audience it lost over the last decade, it feels like it will be in Koei Tecmo's best interest to make the newest installments in the series accessible to as wide a player base as possible. This, of course, can be achieved by putting the newer installments of the franchise on Game Pass. While Ninja Gaiden 2 Black and Ninja Gaiden 4 are already on the service, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound arguably needs the Game Pass bag the most, because it is inherently more niche than the other two entries in the series. People who are willing to buy Ninja Gaiden 4 and Ninja Gaiden 2 Black may not be as interested in getting Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound , simply due to the fact that it's a 2D platformer with pixel-art graphics.

Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound Would Be a Great Introduction to the Series for Game Pass Subscribers

Although Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound is probably not going to appeal to a wide audience, the game itself seems to be pretty great, all things considered. The game has received glowing reviews across the board so far, and its high OpenCritic rating puts it firmly among the best platformers of 2025. Since the game is fairly high-quality, it would be a great entry point for newcomers to the franchise who are subscribed to Game Pass. If Koei Tecmo and Dotemu added Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound to Microsoft's subscription service, they could get players who would otherwise be uninterested in the game to check it out and potentially purchase it (or the other Ninja Gaiden games) outright later on.

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. Arms Week in Destiny 2 continues on for another few days, letting players chase for new rolls on the Ribbontail trace rifle or Phoneutria Fera hand cannon, as well as the Holofoil variants.

Even qwith the first round of Arms Week ending next Tuesday at reset, players won't have to wait long for the next event. Bungie revealed the new version of Destiny 2 's Solstice event, which has seemingly ditched the traditional Bonfire Bash activity. In addition to new armor sets and other rewards, players will be able to play the Solstice Scorched Crucible mode as well as utilize new solar-themed modifiers for the Portal.

With the weekend finally here, the weekend merchant Xur is back with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of August 1, 2025.
